email.title: Weekly Digest

image.alt: Stack of biscuits on a plate
image.title: I can't think of an alt text for this one

email.text:
Welcome to another digest!
Last week we kicked off for our IC Hack 20 volunteer onboarding and we want to say "thank you" to all passionate students who came - IC Hack is only possible because of you! If you have missed the meeting but are still interested to help, you can catch the slides at https://docsoc.co.uk/ichack20kickoffcatchup.
Over the next week, we have planned many academic and off-campus events if you are looking for something to distract you from your coursework! We also have some sponsor events and notices, so make sure you read till the end!
email.heading: Imperial College iGEM team
email.text: This year, SynBIC (synthetic biology society at Imperial College), will be gathering an interdisciplinary team of exceptional undergraduate students for the international synthetic biology competition - iGEM. The 2020 Imperial undergraduate team is currently looking for people with strong computing backgrounds until the 15th of November. This google form must be completed to apply, and a CV must be submitted at the end of the form. Please note that the iGEM team will not be accepting applicants on the first year of their degree.
email.heading: Imperial Mathematics Competition
email.text:
Challenge yourself with maths puzzles in the third edition of Imperial Mathematics Competition! Round One of the annual contest will take place in late November, when contestants, from universities across the UK, will be given 3 hours to solve 6 problems individually. The top performers will be invited to Round Two (the final round) in Term 2.
Sign up [here](https://icmathscomp.org/signup/). You can have a look at [past papers here](https://icmathscomp.org/pages/past-papers.html).
Students from all departments are welcomed, both undergraduate and one-year master's. Some of the problems on the papers may require knowledge from the first year of an undergraduate course in Maths, much of which is covered in science and engineering courses as well. A separate team competition will be run in Term 2, with details to be announced in January.
The deadline for signing up for the individual contest is **18th of November** and the competition will take place on **Sunday 24th November 9:30 - 12:30** in Huxley.
email.heading: Reading Group by Sophia Drossopoulou

event.text:
**Please note this event has been rescheduled to the 19th of November. We apologize for the inconvenience.**
Come and join us at our bi-weekly Reading Groups. This time we have Sophia Drossopoulou who will talk about her research "Holistic specifications for robust code". This talk is aimed at penultimate/4th year undergraduate as well as postgraduate students.
Abstract Functional specifications of program components describe what the code can do — the sufficient conditions to invoke the component’s operations: a client who supplies arguments meeting that operation’s preconditions can invoke it, and obtain the associated effect. While specifications of sufficient conditions may be enough to reason about complete, unchanging programs, they cannot support reasoning about components that interact with external components of possibly unknown provenance. In this open world setting, ensuring that your component is robust even when executing with buggy or malicious external code is critical. Holistic specifications — as their name implies — are concerned with the overall behaviour of a component, in all possible interleavings of calls to the component’s operations with those of the external code. Thus, holistic specifications are concerned with sufficient conditions, i.e. what is enough to cause some effect, as well as with necessary conditions, i.e. what are the conditions without which an effect will not happen. By adopting holistic specification techniques, programmers can explicitly define what their components should not do, making it easier to write robust and reliable programs.
In this work we argue for the need for such holistic specifications, propose a language Chainmail for writing specifications, give a formal semantics, and discuss several examples from the literature.

email.heading: How to build your website with VueJS (Advanced)

event.text:
DoCSoc presents the second workshop on Web Development: "How to build your website"! Come and learn more advanced content on web development! Learn you to use your first javascript framework (VueJS) using components and animations to make your website look amazing!
This event is for everyone interested in learning javascript frameworks or expanding your knowledge by adding Vue to your toolset. Creating your own responsive and good looking website is a great thing to do or know how to do for your your career and future.
This event will be catered with free pizza and soft drinks as usual! Please press GOING to help us gauge our food ordering requirements. If you have any specific dietary requirements, please let us know a few days beforehand by emailing docsoc@imperial.ac.uk
_______
You must be a member of DoCSoc on the day of the event in order to participate. Computing, JMC, and EIE students are automatically DoCSoc members. Membership can be purchased for £30 at docsoc.co.uk/join.

email.heading: Ed Tech Hackday

event.text:
Join DoC on Saturday 23rd for a one day Hackathon to learn how your education tools (Materials, eMarking and more) are made.
Please RSVP here: https://forms.gle/foZwZKEN6XVrNVr68
Learn how real webapps work, challenge yourselves to contribute to these open source projects with new and amazing ideas, and win the prize for the best contribution, OR show us your web apps knowledge by creating a whole new webapp that will help the EdTech ecosystem!
Lunch will be provided on the day, so let us know if you plan to attend by selecting "going"

email.heading: Faces of Engineering

event.location: City and Guilds College Union CGCU
event.text:
JFaces of Engineering is CGCU's annual engineering diversity event, bringing together students, industry professionals, and engineers from all walks of life. Over the past few years, we have had the privilege of hosting companies like Google, Microsoft, and P&G, among others.
This year, we are please to announce that we have confirmed the attendance of Bloomberg, American Express, and Qualcomm, with more companies expected to attend! Do be sure to come down and get a chance to meet the panelists and understand more about different types of engineering professions.
This year, we are renaming the event "Faces of Engineering"; with Imperial being one of the world's most diverse universities, we at the CGCU are continuously striving to fully engage staff, students, and the community. We warmly welcome people of all cultures, languages, and backgrounds to this event and hope to see a wonderful turnout!
Details on the location will be confirmed shortly, but in the mean time do sign up to the event using the link below. There will be a catered networking session after the panel discussion too!
Thank you and we look forward to seeing you!

email.heading: Tickets on sale! DoCSoc goes Mini Golfing

event.text:
Drop your keyboards and pick up your putters, because DoCSoc is going Mini Golf and we want you join in the fun with us!
DoCSoc will be heavily subsidising tickets to just £6.00! We only have a limited number of tickets for this event, so make sure to try and get one.
The event starts at 3pm at Puttshack White City! - stay tuned for more updates about this.
TICKETS WILL BE RELEASED ON FRIDAY (15TH NOVEMBER) AT 1PM ON EVENTBRITE. With this please go to the Imperial College Union Shop to purchase your ticket, you have a 2 hour window in order to confirm your purchase! YOU CAN ONLY BUY A UNION SHOP TICKET IF YOU HAVE AN [EVENTBRITE PLACEHOLDER TICKET](https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/docsoc-goes-mini-golf-tickets-81620853169?fbclid=IwAR0cxwGJ1c6YFT5pXupva78EJmBHmOZmJ8oNUOIerYXHEUeEPHyffltna94).
We hope to see you there!
-------------------------------------------------------------- You must be a member of DoCSoc by Tuesday 13th November in order to be admitted. Computing, JMC, and EIE students are automatically members of DoCSoc. Membership is £30.
Find out more: http://docsoc.co.uk/join

email.heading: Women Create - Coding Interview Workshop

event.text:
Hi there!
Come learn how to put your best foot forward at this Women Create - Crush Your Coding Interview Workshop hosted by Facebook.
This presentation, delivered by one of Facebook’s Software Engineers will cover:
- How to walk through an algorithm problem,
- How to brainstorm solutions,
- How to discuss the problem with your interviewer,
- How to write (and test) code on a whiteboard
- Office Tour
Sign-up link: https://womencreate-codinginterviewwor.splashthat.com/
Visit this link to prepare: https://www.facebook.com/careers/life/preparing-for-your-software-engineering-interview-at-facebook
We look forward to seeing you there!
The Facebook Team

email.heading: LSEG WIN Breakfast Session: LCH Debunking the Derivative World

event.text:
LSEG is at heart of the UK’s financial industry and is home to one of the oldest stock exchanges in the world. The Women Inspired Network harnesses’ the power and reputation of this renowned organisation to inspire, educate and pave the way for the next generation of graduates.
This session will focus on the role that LCH has to play as a systematically important component of Global financial market infrastructure, and the contribution that the Group has to financial market innovation and evolution.
If you are interested in attending please email [docsoc@imperial.ac.uk](mailto:docsoc@imperial.ac.uk) with your forename and surname. See attached pdf for more information.

email.heading: Entrepreneur First London: November Open Office

event.location: Entrepreneur First, Lincoln Building, The Biscuit Factory, Drummond Road, London, SE16 4DG
event.text:
Hear from one of Entrepreneur First's cofounders and meet the EF team on Monday 25th November 2019
Over drinks and snacks, we'll be having conversations about:
+ Why entrepreneurship is the career path to scale your ambition + What we look for in future founders + Applying to EF & the admissions process + What the programme looks like in detail
WHEN: Monday 25th November 2019 from 6.00-7.30pm WHERE: The Entrepreneur First Office, Block L
We look forward to helping you found the future.
Applications are now open **for the London April cohort**.
You can apply at joinef.com
---
About Entrepreneur First: We fund exceptional individuals to build their own companies at a very early stage. We were recently backed by Reid Hoffman, founder of LinkedIn, who lead a $12m investment in Entrepreneur First, alongside Lakestar, and the founders of Google DeepMind.
Read more: https://techcrunch.com/2017/09/11/ef-greylock/

email.heading: Liquidnet Interactive Session: Graduate Recruitment; Trading & AI

event.location: Liquidnet Offices, 24 Floor, Broadgate Tower, Primrose St, London EC2A 2EW
event.text:
Join Liquidnet for pizza and prosecco followed by a talk at their offices, 24 floors up in the heart of the City of London. It's a great way to network and learn more about the company, while having fun!
Check out the event information below and RSVP **for free** in [Eventbrite](https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/liquidnet-interactive-session-graduate-recruitment-trading-ai-tickets-80036171343).
_Please note this event is 18+ only._
---
Traders in financial markets perform tasks that require them to absorb large amounts of data in limited time and make rapid decisions. Time is money and sub-optimal performance can cost firms hundreds of millions of dollars a year. Liquidnet augments the human expert with a variety of technologies, from anomaly detection pattern recognition algorithms to natural language generation and visualizations.
**Join Liquidnet Chief Data Scientist Tom Doris, PhD.** to discuss challenges in adoption and adherence of new technologies by human experts, deconstruct the methods that were effective in overcoming the obstacles, and review similarities across other industries.
There will be an opportunity to network with members of Tom's Technology team, our Recruitment Team and Product Team once the interactive session has ended.
Refreshments will be served.

email.heading: StarLeaf Student and Graduate Roles Now Live!
email.sponsor:
StarLeaf have now launched their new [Careers Hub](https://jobs.starleaf.com/) and their 2020 student and graduate roles.
**Graduate roles**\ So, you are in your final year at Uni and you find yourself here, looking for a job that you will start nearly a year away! Well, we salute you. The last thing you need during your exams next year is to have interviews to worry about, even worse, countless calls from recruiters telling you about an “exciting new opportunity.”
We are not hanging about either. We are interviewing people right now to start with us in 2020. It’s a win win, we get to hire the smartest people and you get to secure yourself an awesome job and sit back and relax over the festive break.
Check out our opportunities and get in touch with us now to find out some more and ask any questions you may have.
**Intern roles**\ StarLeaf are currently looking for 2020 Interns to join our software engineering teams. They will be attending a lot of careers fairs between now and the end of the year, so please do pop by and say hello.
https://www.starleaf.com/careers/students-and-graduates/ - Showcase of Life at StarLeaf as a student or graduate and hear from the Humans of StarLeaf.
**Opportunities**
[Product Team Graduate](https://www.starleaf.com/careers/jobs/job/580CF18AC2-product-team-graduate/) – Watford\ [Graduate Cloud Ops Engineer](https://www.starleaf.com/careers/jobs/job/5788C13092-graduate-cloud-operations-engineer/) - Watford\ [Graduate Software Engineer 2020 intake](https://www.starleaf.com/careers/jobs/job/42D5BFD4BA-graduate-software-engineer-2020-intake/) – Watford\ [Software Engineer Intern 2020 intake](https://www.starleaf.com/careers/jobs/job/90395F60A1-software-engineer-intern-2020-intake/) - Watford\ [Graduate Software Engineer 2020 intake](https://www.starleaf.com/careers/jobs/job/8B350E9DB8-graduate-software-engineer-2020-intake/) – Cambridge\ [Software Engineer Intern 2020 intake](https://www.starleaf.com/careers/jobs/job/696FB8624B-software-engineer-intern-2020-intake/) - Cambridge\ [Graduate Solutions Consultant](https://www.starleaf.com/careers/jobs/job/9C0B8D382D-graduate-solutions-consultant/) – London
email.heading: FinTech internships at London Stock Exchange Group
email.sponsor:
We are looking for motivated students with a real interest in technology and financial markets to join our 2020 nine-week Summer Internship Programme.
From Artificial Intelligence to Blockchain, Machine Learning to high-speed trading platforms, being a technologist at London Stock Exchange Group (LSEG) means being part of an exciting team that’s shaping the fast-changing future of the global financial services markets.
Our technology internship programme offers you unique exposure to a wide variety of leading technical, analytical and project management career path opportunities. You could find yourself working on cyber security, introducing leading cutting-edge software or helping to implement Robotic Process Automation and much more.
As well as the formal induction training and two four week rotations across our business we offer a range of other development programmes within our friendly and supportive workplace environment.
Whichever way you look at it, this is an incredible platform from which to launch your career.
Learn more today: lseg.com/graduates
